abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey a satisfactory
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Sector-wide lessons
            highlight the quality of the initial project design which
            was clear and relatively simple, yet not simplistic: the
            components were both consistent for the stakeholders and
            understandable to the public. This ensured clear guidance to
            all those involved in implementation. Nevertheless, areas of
            weakness point at the absence of a sector-wide base-line
            survey, which could have been carried out at the start of
            the Project. In the specific case of Moldova, such a survey
            would have clearly displayed the state of art of the current
            system; at the same time, it would have constituted a
            valuable frame of reference for any further project
            evaluation. Moreover, the project did not have a clear set
            of quality indicators and quality monitoring mechanisms.
            This proved necessary; and the implementation quality
            monitoring should have been in place as of the early stages,
            offering valuable and timely data for further improvements.
            The institutional reform undertaken under the project
            covered mostly Ministry or Ministry-related bodies. While
            this was part of the first reform steps and cannot be
            considered a weakness, schools need more support to shift
            from their status of mere implementing bodies, to the one of
            responsible learning organizations, and it is this that
            should be addressed in future projects. Similarly,
            intermediate level managers - i.e. rayon inspectors,
            methodologists and school managers - should have been
            specifically trained for the implementation process. The
            discrepancy between the training provided to teachers, and
            the one for school administrators and inspectors was a
            highly dysfunctional factor during the implementation.
